trans-unit.source: Get Started with Event Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Event Hubs

trans-unit.source: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Event Hubs with C# and using the EventProcessorHost.
trans-unit.target: Follow this tutorial to get started using Azure Event Hubs with C# and using the EventProcessorHost.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Event Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Event Hubs

trans-unit.source: Introduction
trans-unit.target: Introduction

trans-unit.source: Event Hubs is a service that processes large amounts of event data from connected devices and applications.
trans-unit.target: Event Hubs is a service that processes large amounts of event data from connected devices and applications.

trans-unit.source: After you collect data into Event Hubs, you can store the data using a storage cluster or transform it using a real-time analytics provider.
trans-unit.target: After you collect data into Event Hubs, you can store the data using a storage cluster or transform it using a real-time analytics provider.

trans-unit.source: This large scale event collection and processing capability is a key component of modern application architectures including the Internet of Things (IoT).
trans-unit.target: This large scale event collection and processing capability is a key component of modern application architectures including the Internet of Things (IoT).

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to use the Azure portal to create an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to use the Azure portal to create an Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: It also shows you how to collect messages into an Event Hub using a console application written in C#, and how to retrieve them in parallel using the C# [Event Processor Host] library.
trans-unit.target: It also shows you how to collect messages into an Event Hub using a console application written in C#, and how to retrieve them in parallel using the C# [Event Processor Host] library.

trans-unit.source: In order to complete this tutorial you'll need the following:
trans-unit.target: In order to complete this tutorial you'll need the following:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013, or Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual Studio 2013, or Microsoft Visual Studio Express 2013 for Windows.

trans-unit.source: An active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: An active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdevelop%2Fmobile%2Ftutorials%2Fget-started%2F target="_blank").
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mc_id=A0E0E5C02&returnurl=http%3A%2F%2Fazure.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Fdevelop%2Fmobile%2Ftutorials%2Fget-started%2F target="_blank").

trans-unit.source: Create an Event Hub
trans-unit.target: Create an Event Hub

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure management portal], and click **NEW** at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure management portal], and click **NEW** at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Services**, then **Service Bus**, then **Event Hub**, then **Quick Create**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Services**, then **Service Bus**, then **Event Hub**, then **Quick Create**.

trans-unit.source: Type a name for your Event Hub, select your desired region, and then click **Create a new Event Hub**.
trans-unit.target: Type a name for your Event Hub, select your desired region, and then click **Create a new Event Hub**.

trans-unit.source: Click the namespace you just created (usually ***event hub name*-ns**).
trans-unit.target: Click the namespace you just created (usually ***event hub name*-ns**).

trans-unit.source: Click the **Event Hubs** tab at the top of the page, and then click the Event Hub you just created.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Event Hubs** tab at the top of the page, and then click the Event Hub you just created.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Configure** tab at the top, add a rule named **SendRule** with *Send* rights, add another rule called **ReceiveRule** with *Manage, Send, Listen* rights, and then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Configure** tab at the top, add a rule named **SendRule** with *Send* rights, add another rule called **ReceiveRule** with *Manage, Send, Listen* rights, and then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Dashboard** tab at the top of the page, and then click **Connection Information**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Dashboard** tab at the top of the page, and then click **Connection Information**.

trans-unit.source: Take note of the two connection strings, or copy them somewhere to use later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Take note of the two connection strings, or copy them somewhere to use later in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Your Event Hub is now created, and you have the connection strings you need to send and receive events.
trans-unit.target: Your Event Hub is now created, and you have the connection strings you need to send and receive events.

trans-unit.source: Run the applications
trans-unit.target: Run the applications

trans-unit.source: Now you are ready to run the applications.
trans-unit.target: Now you are ready to run the applications.

trans-unit.source: From within Visual Studio, run the **Receiver** project, then wait for it to start the receivers for all the partitions.
trans-unit.target: From within Visual Studio, run the **Receiver** project, then wait for it to start the receivers for all the partitions.

trans-unit.source: Run the **Sender** project, press **Enter** in the console windows, and see the events appear in the receiver window.
trans-unit.target: Run the **Sender** project, press **Enter** in the console windows, and see the events appear in the receiver window.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Now that you've built a working application that creates an Event Hub and sends and receives data, you can move on to the following scenarios:

trans-unit.target: A complete [sample application that uses Event Hubs].

trans-unit.target: The [Scale out Event Processing with Event Hubs] sample.

trans-unit.target: A [queued messaging solution] using Service Bus queues.
